Package it.polimi.ingsw.server

Class GameHandler

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.server.GameHandler
Direct Known Subclasses:
GodSelectionControllerTest.GameHandlerStub, TurnControllerTest.GameHandlerStub
public class GameHandler
extends java.lang.Object
This class handles a single match, instantiating a game mode (Game class) and a main controller (Controller class). It also manages the startup phase, like the marker's color selection.
Version:
2.0.0
Author:
Luca Pirovano

    Preliminary player setup phase; in this phase the color of workers' markers will be asked the player, with a double check (on both client and server sides) of the validity of them (also in case of duplicate colors).

  • Constructor Details

    • GameHandler

      public GameHandler​(Server server)

  • Method Details

    • isStarted

      public int isStarted()
      Returns:
      if the game has started (the started attribute becomes true after the challenger selection phase).

    • setPlayersNumber

      public void setPlayersNumber​(int playersNumber)
      Set the active players number of the match, decided by the first connected player.
      Parameters:
      playersNumber - the number of the playing clients.

    • setupPlayer

      public void setupPlayer​(java.lang.String nickname, int clientID)
      This method receives a nickname from the server application and creates a new player in the game class.
      Parameters:
      nickname - the chosen nickname, after a duplicates check.

    • getCurrentPlayerID

      public int getCurrentPlayerID()
      Returns:
      the current player client ID, getting him from the currentPlayer reference in the Game class.

    • singleSend

      public void singleSend​(Answer message, int id)
      Send to a client, identified by his ID number, a determined message through the server socket.
      Parameters:
      message - the message to be sent to the client.
      id - the unique identification number of the client to be contacted.

    • sendAll

      public void sendAll​(Answer message)
      Same as the previous method, but it iterates on all the clients present in the game. It's a full effects broadcast.
      Parameters:
      message - the message to broadcast (at single match participants' level).

    • sendAllExcept

      public void sendAllExcept​(Answer message, int excludedID)
      Same as the previous method, but it iterates on all the clients present in the game, except the declared one.
      Parameters:
      message - the message to be transmitted.
      excludedID - the client which will not receive the communication.

    • setup

      public void setup()
      Preliminary player setup phase; in this phase the color of workers' markers will be asked the player, with a double check (on both client and server sides) of the validity of them (also in case of duplicate colors).

    • getController

      public Controller getController()
      Returns:
      the main game manager controller.
      See Also:
      for more information.

    • getServer

      public Server getServer()
      Returns:
      the server class.

    • makeAction

      public void makeAction​(UserAction action, java.lang.String type)
      Handles an action received from a single client. It makes several instance checks. It's based on the value of "started", which represents the current game phase, in this order: - 0: color phase - 1: challenger phase; - 2: players select their god powers; - 3: board worker placement; - 4: the game has started.
      Parameters:
      action - the action sent by the client.

    • workerPlacement

      public void workerPlacement​(WorkerSetupMessage action)
      Handles the worker placement phase by checking the correctness of the user's input and if the selected cell is free or occupied by someone else.
      Parameters:
      action - the move action.

    • challengerPhaseChoose

      public void challengerPhaseChoose​(ChallengerPhaseAction userAction, java.lang.String godSelection)
      Handles the second game phase: the user chooses his god card. If he is in the wrong turn phase (checked by the "started" int value) an error message in created and sent to the client, who is requested to send another command.
      Parameters:
      userAction - the action of the current player.
      godSelection - the selection of the god card.

    • challengerPhase

      public void challengerPhase​(UserAction action)
      Handles the challenger game phase (based on the listener message). It triggers the correct method relying on the started value.
      Parameters:
      action - the action to be performed

    • unregisterPlayer

      public void unregisterPlayer​(int id)
      Unregister a player identified by his unique ID, after a disconnection event or message.
      Parameters:
      id - the unique id of the client to be unregistered.

    • endGame

      public void endGame​(java.lang.String leftNickname)
      Terminates the game, disconnecting all the players. This method is invoked after a disconnection of a player. It also unregisters each client connected to the server, freeing a new lobby.

    • endGame

      public void endGame()
      Terminates the game, disconnecting all the players. This method is invoked after a player has won. It also unregisters each client connected to the server, freeing a new lobby.
